ca.weblite.irblaster

Class IRBlaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.weblite.irblaster.IRBlaster

  • public class IRBlaster
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides access to the device’s IR blaster if it has one. Currently this is only supported on Android, and acts as a wrapper around the ConsumerIrManager class.

    Usage Example

    if (IRBlaster.hasIrEmitter()) {
    int frequency = 38000;
    int[] codes = new int[]{5, 6, 7, ...};
    IRBlaster.transmit(frequency, codes);
}

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  IRBlaster.CarrierFrequencyRange
      Represents a range of carrier frequencies (inclusive) on which the infrared transmitter can transmit

      • hasIrEmitter

        public static boolean hasIrEmitter()

        Check whether the device has an infrared emitter.

        Returns:
        True if the device has IR emitter.

      • getCarrierFrequencies

        public static IRBlaster.CarrierFrequencyRange[] getCarrierFrequencies()

        Query the infrared transmitter’s supported carrier frequencies

        Returns:

      • transmit

        public static void transmit(int carrierFrequency,
                            int[] pattern)

        Transmit an infrared pattern This method is synchronous; when it returns the pattern has been transmitted.

        Parameters:
        carrierFrequency - The IR carrier frequency in Hertz.
        pattern - The alternating on/off pattern in microseconds to transmit.
